level.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the amount or degree of something, compared to another amount or degree
level.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Inflation fell to its lowest level in 30 years.
Increased supplies are needed to meet the level of demand.
Dolphins show a high level of intelligence.
level.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a particular standard of skill or ability, for example in education or sport
level.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Few athletes can compete at international level.
Students at this level may have problems with basic grammar.
What level do you think you’re at?
level.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: the height of something in relation to the ground or to another object
level.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Skirts this year are just above knee level.
Check the water level in the car radiator.
Your arms should be at the same level as your desk.
level.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a floor or area of ground that is at a particular height, especially when you can go up or down to other floors or areas
level.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Didn’t we park the car on Level 2?
The town is built on different levels.
The medical center is on one level  (=so that you do not have to go up or down).
level.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a particular position in a system that has different ranks of importance
level.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Further talks at ministerial level were held.
Training is offered at each level in the department.
level.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a way of considering or understanding something
level.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: I agree with you, but only on a theoretical level.
The story can be understood on many different levels.
level.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: a tool used for checking that a surface is flat
level.translation[0].note_box[0].section: The level of salt in his diet was too high.
The level of violent crime is lower than ten years ago.
Wage levels had failed to keep up with inflation.
I find exercise helps with my stress levels.
Her fitness level is better than that of most 20-year-olds.
The level of unemployment has increased.
China’s imports of wheat reached record levels.
The fees are likely to remain at current levels.
It's difficult to maintain the same level of physical fitness.
Healthy eating can increase your energy level.
He made an effort to reduce his stress levels.
level.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: flat and not sloping in any direction
level.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The floors in the old house were not completely level.
a level surface suitable for wheelchairs
level.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: two things that are level are at the same height as each other
level.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Your eyes should be level with the top of the screen.
level.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: two sports teams, competitors etc that are level have the same number of points
level.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: They finished level, with ten points each.
Before the weekend, Madrid was level with Barcelona.
level.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: having the same value or position as something or someone else
level.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: He cycled along beside her, keeping level.
Borrowing rates rose to over 8%, roughly level with those in America.
level.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to make something flat and smooth
level.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Workers leveled the wet concrete with a piece of wood.
Cover with a layer of sand and level it off.
level.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: to knock down or destroy a building or area completely
level.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: Bombs levelled a large part of the town.
level.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: to make the score in a game or competition equal
level.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: He slipped the ball into the net to level the score at 1–1.
United went ahead but the visitors levelled in the 73rd minute.
level.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: the measured amount of something that exists at a particular time or in a particular place
level.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The longer poor performance continues, the more comfortable employees become with their lower level of productivity.
level.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: all the people or jobs within an organization, industry etc that have similar importance and responsibility
level.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: Due to the importance of the issue, negotiations will have to be held at a more senior level.
We need to recruit more employees at the management level.
